The Guards title was awarded to units and formations which distinguishing themselves in battle during the Great Patriotic War of 1941-1945 by the order of People's Commissar for Defence of USSR No.303 on the 18 September 1941, and were considered to have elite status.  However," the Guards badge was not introduced until 21 May 1943."

Guards Heavy Armor Brigade.  The Guards title was awarded to units and formations which distinguishing themselves in battle during the Great Patriotic War of 1941-1945 by the order of People's Commissar for Defence of USSR No.303 on the 18 September 1941, and were considered to have elite status.  However," the Guards badge was not introduced until 21 May 1943."

Guards Cavalry brigade.  The Guards title was awarded to units and formations which distinguishing themselves in battle during the Great Patriotic War of 1941-1945 by the order of People's Commissar for Defence of USSR No.303 on the 18 September 1941, and were considered to have elite status.  However," the Guards badge was not introduced until 21 May 1943."

Guards Paratroop Brigade,The Guards title was awarded to units and formations which distinguishing themselves in battle during the Great Patriotic War of 1941-1945 by the order of People's Commissar for Defence of USSR No.303 on the 18 September 1941, and were considered to have elite status.  However," the Guards badge was not introduced until 21 May 1943."

Guards Katushya Brigade.  The Guards title was awarded to units and formations which distinguishing themselves in battle during the Great Patriotic War of 1941-1945 by the order of People's Commissar for Defence of USSR No.303 on the 18 September 1941, and were considered to have elite status.  However," the Guards badge was not introduced until 21 May 1943."

Kamikaze Aircraft.  Kamikaze (common translation: divine wind) were suicide attacks by military aviators designed to destroy as many warships as possible.  These units are expensive and literally kill off large amounts of officers in one attack.  However they are very effective at sinking enemy shipping.

Gurkha Brigades.  Gurkha units are closely associated with the khukuri, a forward-curving Nepalese knife of formidable fighting power.  Former Chief of staff of the Indian Army, Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw, once famously said about Gurkhas: If a man says he is not afraid of dying, he is either lying or is a Gurkha.  A total of 250,280 Gurkhas served in 40 battalions, plus eight Nepalese Army battalions, plus Parachute, training, garrison, and porter units during the war in almost all theatres.\n\nIn addition to keeping the peace in India, Gurkhas fought in Syria, North Africa, Italy, Greece, against the Japanese in the jungles of Burma, northeast India and Singapore.  They did so with considerable distinction, earning 2,734 bravery awards in the process and suffering around 32,"000 casualties in all theatres."

The exact strength of the Vichy French Metropolitan Army was set at 3,768 officers,15,072 non-commissioned officers, and 75,360 men.  All members had to be volunteers.  In addition to the army, the size of the Gendarmerie was fixed at 60,000 men plus an anti-aircraft force of 10,000 men.  Despite the influx of trained soldiers from the colonial forces (reduced in size in accordance with the Armistice), there was a shortage of volunteers.\n\nAs a result,30,000 men of the class of 1939 were retained to fill the quota.  At the beginning of 1942 these conscripts were released, but there was still an insufficient number of men.  This shortage would remain until the dissolution," despite Vichy appeals to the Germans for a regular form of conscription."

Need a little extra cash Sell some of your hard earned supply-pool to the Bank for International Settlements. The supplies will go to the Swiss (unless they join a faction or are occupied).  If you attack the Swiss, the ability to sell supplies this way will end.

Based on the legendary I.C.E. mod by Diday, we are proud to bring you BLACK I.C.E.!

The mod has been developed by countless people over the last few years and continues to push the boundaries of what can be modded in HOI3.  Almost every file and line of code has been taken apart, looked at and put back together. Constantly updated with new units, techs and events, Black I.C.E. has put the Iron into HOI3!

We promise you will never go back to a vanilla game again.  Here you can choose a difficulty setting and let the game commence.
Choose where you would like your nation to focus its production efforts during the coming year.

In the course of the new Soviet offensive a heavy skirmish occurred.  As the focus of an attack further South in Novgorod ocurred, Kampfgruppe Bock was formed from elements of the SS Polizei Division.  This unit was rushed to XXXVIII Army Corps.  In the following battles," the Kampfgruppe was almost completely smashed."

Kampfgruppe Kempf was an ad-hoc unit formed just for the Polish Campaign.  It was formed by adding the 7th Panzer Regiment and other elements to SS Deutchland Motorized Infantry Regiment.  This was the only time in the entire war that regular army units and SS units were mixed together in the same formation like this.

The German forces are down to their last.  In a desperate attempt to halt the Red tide, the staff at the Kummersdorf proving ground take an untested tank into combat - the mighty 188 ton type 205/2 Maus!

Success is attributable to meeting all 4 of the following conditions:

1. A strong initial drive by a small group of scientists, to launch the project.

2. Unconditional government support from a certain point in time.

3. Essentially unlimited manpower and industrial resources.

4. A concentration of brilliant scientists devoted to the project.

For the Manhattan Project, the second condition was met on 9 October 1941 or shortly thereafter. By the end of 1941 it was apparent that the German nuclear energy project would not make a decisive contribution to the war effort in the near term, and control of the project was relinquished by the Heereswaffenamt (Army Ordnance Office) to the Reichsforschungsrat (Reich Research Council) in July 1942.

Concerning condition 3, the needs in materiel and manpower for a large-scale project necessary for the separation of isotopes for a uranium-based bomb and heavy water production for reactors for a plutonium-based bomb may have been possible in the early years of the war.

As to condition 4, the high priority of the Manhattan Project allowed for the recruitment and concentration of capable scientists.  In Germany, on the other hand, a great many young scientists and technicians who would have been of great use to such a project were conscripted into the German armed forces, and others fled the country.

The Berghof was Adolf Hitler's home in the Obersalzberg retreat of the Bavarian Alps near Berchtesgaden, Bavaria, Germany.  Other than the Wolfsschanze in East Prussia, Hitler spent more time at the Berghof than anywhere else during World War II.  It was also one of the most widely known of his headquarters, which were located throughout Europe.

Adlerhorst (Eagle's Eyrie) was a World War II bunker complex in Germany.  It is located within Kransberg Castle, Wetterau in the Taunus Mountains in the province of Hesse.  Designed by Albert Speer as Adolf Hitler's main military command complex, it was reassigned by Hitler in February 1940 to Luftwaffe chief Hermann Goering as his headquarters for the Battle of Britain.  Later, it served as the Führer's military headquarters during the 1944/5 Ardennes Offensive.

Hitler was in Führerhauptquartier (FHQ) Tannenberg from June 27 until July 5,1940, just after the occupation of France.  In this week he was in Freudenstadt, a city nearby the FHQ.  Hitler is said to have visited the Lazarett (Military Hospital), where wounded German soldiers were treated.

The Führer's Special Train (Führersonderzug in German) was used frequently by Hitler to travel between various headquarters throughout Europe.  It also served as headquarters, called FHQu Frühlingssturm (Spring Storm), at Moenichkirchen, Austria, during the Balkans Campaign in the spring of 1941.  The train was named Führersonderzug Amerika in 1940," and later "Führersonderzug Brandenburg".  After the Balkans Campaign the train was not used as a Führer Headquarters", but Hitler used it throughout the war when he travelled between Berlin, Berchtesgaden," Munich and other headquarters."

Führerhauptquartier Wolfsschluct I (Wolf's Gorge or Wolf's Glen) was the codename for one of Adolf Hitler's military headquarters located in a farmhouse outside the Belgian village of Brûly-de-Pesche, in the municipality of Couvin, close to the French border.  It was occupied by Hitler between 624 June 1940 while awaiting the conclusion of the Battle of France.

Anlage Sud, was a pair of railway headquarters built for Adolf Hitler in the southern Nazi-occupied part of Poland during the Second World War.  Two reinforced tunnels were built near the rail line between Rzeszów to Jaslo.  One bunker was located in the village of Stepina, 45 km. south of Rzeszów, the other was in the town of Strzyzów, 30 km. south of Rzeszów.  They were initially used for a two-day meeting between Hitler and Mussolini, on 2728 August 1941.

At the start of the Western European campaign of 1940, the Felsennest,Rocky Eyrie was the codename for one of Hitler's Führer-Headquarters near Bad Münstereifel, Germany.  It was much more cramped than Adolf Hitler's other field bunkers, having only four rooms.  Hitler was at the Felsennest in the autumn of 1939, because there were plans to invade France and the Low Countries at that time.  He was there again on May 10," 1940 when the invasion took place."

Wolfsschanze or Wolf's Lair, was Adolf Hitler's first World War II Eastern Front military headquarters.  The complex, which was built for Operation Barbarossa, was located in the Masurian woods, about 8 kilometres from the small East Prussian town of Rastenburg.  The original bunker system was constructed by Organisation Todt, but the later-planned enlargement was never finished.  The expansion work was stopped only a few days before the Soviet advance.  Hitler first arrived at the Wolf's Lair late on the night of 23 June 1941, and departed for the last time on 20 November 1944.  Overall," he spent over 800 days there during that 3.5 year period."

Führerhauptquartier-Werwolf was the codename used for one of Adolf Hitler's World War II Eastern Front military headquarters located in a pine forest about 12 kilometres north of Vinnitsa in the Ukraine that was used between 1942 and 1943.  It was the most easterly ever used by Hitler in person.

Führerhauptquartier Wolfsschlucht II or W2 was the codename used for one of Adolf Hitler's World War II Western Front military headquarters located in Margival, 10 km northeast of Soissons in the department of Aisne in France.  It was used only one time by Adolf Hitler, June 16 and 17, 1944 for a meeting with Field Marshals Rommel and von Rundstedt with regard to the Normandy Front.

The Führerbunker was an air-raid shelter located near the Reich Chancellery in Berlin, Germany.  It was part of a subterranean bunker complex which was constructed in two major phases, one part in 1936 and the other in 1943.  Hitler took up residence in the Führerbunker on 16 January 1945 and it became the epicentre of the Nazi regime until the last week of World War II.  Hitler married Eva Braun here during the last week of April 1945, shortly before they committed suicide.
This Sunday in every town of the country the members and followers of the ruling party come together to celebrate the glory of the nation.
No women are as beautiful as a well trained formation marching in step!
Let's see the fine Navy vessels

Since we have advanced further in political research, we are now able to build one more monumental Building in our Capital.  This will not only mean we have another building, this will change the entire image of a whole district.  Even the whole nation will have a benefit from this.  Some of the local residents won't be happy that they have to vacate for the new complex.

The security of the Homeland is essential for Victory. Therefore, we must give our police forces all the resources they need to do their job. From within this much-feared complex they can control all local policeforces within the borders of our country. Check the Strategic Effects tab to see what is gained from going ahead with this project
This is the Heart of Power, where every major decision is made! Check the Strategic effects tab to see what is gained from going ahead with this project

Entertainment, Heroic Tales and News & Politics.  All this can be produced from a major movie studio. We will be independent from foreign brainwashing and gain some money as well.  Let the flavor of International Movie Stars support the course of the nation. Check the Strategic effects tab to see what is gained from going ahead with this project
By exploiting the benefits of global intelligence, we will always be one step ahead the Enemy. Check the Strategic effects tab to see what is gained from going ahead with this project

The Palace of the Party is the central place where the Policy is set into motion.  In the name of the People, the entire Empire is managed by a few Party Officials behind these mighty walls. Check the Strategic effects tab to see what is gained from going ahead with this project
The Law is the first and the last Sign of civilization.  Our Empire is an Empire of Justice.Check the Strategic effects tab to see what is gained from going ahead with this project

It is not only the Sword that decides the course of the Nation.  From time to time it is necessary that we negotiate with minor states. The monumental size of the Imperial Foreign Ministry should help them understand where their place is. Check the Strategic effects tab to see what is gained from going ahead with this project

War is a very expensive business.  The Imperial Finance Ministry generates a huge amount of money and opens the possibility for the sale of advanced Warbonds. Check the Strategic effects tab to see what is gained from going ahead with this project

The planning, preparation and command of military operations on a strategic level is the work of several thouand officers and many more of lower ranks. All employed in the Imperial War Ministry. Check the Strategic effects tab to see what is gained from going ahead with this project
The Imperial University supplies the the Nation with the next generation of Leaders.Check the Strategic effects tab to see what is gained from going ahead with this project
Faster transportation of supplies and troops are the gateway to new strategic opportunities.

The Army has won an important battle.  Since we have researched the technology of Mass Events, we should celebrate this glorious day with a victory parade.  With more experience in mass events we can celebrate greater victories in an adequate style.
In lockstep ...  March!

The Road of Life was the ice-road winter transport route across the frozen Lake Ladoga which provided the only access to the besieged city of Leningrad while the perimeter of the siege was maintained by the German Army Group North and the Finnish Defence Forces.  The siege lasted for 29 months from 8 September 1941, to 27 January 1944.  In total the ice road was used to ship more than 360,000 tons of goods, mostly rations and fodder into Leningrad.
Our recent victories and hard fighting against the Red Hordes have yielded large amounts of inferior quality captured Bolshevik Equipment.
Our recent victories and hard fighting against the Nazi invaders have yielded large amounts of Nazi Equipment.

The unit is best kept safe from combat and primarily adds immersion and flavour to the map. Some of the Political Units have specific events related to their existence on the map. For example Lose Stalin or Hitler and suffer major national unity and revolt risk increase. As the mod develops more political leaders will have events based around them. For now the unit is a useful last ditch defensive formation useful for siege battles. It is moved via strategic deployment or aircraft. The AI will combine them with an Army Group or theatre HQ.

The Battle Commander unit represents an important General. this unit can be used to trun the tide in a battle and provide abit of extra flavour to a command. Your nation might already have a few in the starting OOB, however most are formed via historical event OOBs and the results of battles. Battle Commanders come at a price and their creation should be carefully considered

From this point on new Battle Commanders might form in historical event OOBs, or from the heat of battle. If you are playing as a major nation you might notice you already have some in the starting OOB and that choosing to keep these active costs considerable officers. The more Battle Commanders you utilise the higher the cost in officers. Used carefully a Battle Commander can turn the tide of battle in your favour. Be aware the AI uses them as well..
We have lost a major battle. Many Fathers, Sons and Brothers are now dead or seriously wounded. The whole nation is shocked.

After the last defeat someone has to take the responsibility. We can simply remove some officers from their dutys to make place for more skilled commanders or we can search the guilty person between the lines of the leading party members.

We have been invaded and lost some land. Now our own resources are available to the enemy. If we are forced to make further retreats the enemy should have as least possible advantage from the land they have captured. We should evacuate everything needed for warfare.
The policy of scorched earth means heavy sacrifices by our people. The patience of the people wont last forever.

If we conquer new land it could be possible that we can't hold it. But at least we can try to devastate as much as possible. Of course some people will complain that this is evil, but we are at war and have higher prioritys then being noble.

There are two major decisions 1.Destruction of the enemy land: If you lose a battle with 1000 losses: With this you can damage enemy territory.2. Destruction of the homeland: After a certain amount of surrender progress: This allows you to damage your own provinces.Now use covert-ops to select a province you want to damage. Each neighbouring enemy province loses 1 infra and gains a modifier for some time. 2. Evacuation-point: Under covert-ops you can select a province as Evacuation-point (E.P). You can select as many E.P as you wish. If you dont want that province any more as an E.P choose clrevacuationpoint . 3. Leadership: You can select in every province you control the covert-ops Evacuate the Specialists," so long as you have both decisions. Some LS of the province will be lost and the province has a modifier for some time.The E.P you selected will then gain some LS.4. Industry: You can do the same for industry as for Leadership."

BlackICE uses a different build to HOI3 and mods. It helps to think of brigades as components. A tank division might have a tank component, infantry component + supports. The main components are more powerful and expensive with long build times. The supports are cheaper to build. So the old 3 main + support is not advised. A player should build 2 main + 2 supports div (eg Arm+Mot+TD+AC). The AI builds 1 main + 3 supports. This means the AI can build a large amount of division sized assets. Giving it more flexibility in its use and ability to take advantage of opportunities. This type of division tends to shatter faster in long battles. These divisions need a large reserve of fresh units to be rotated into the battle. In addition shattered units will reform at the theatre HQ  giving the AI a strategic reserve. If a player intends to give control of his armies to the AI, this method of division construction can be effective.

Terrain and Weather in Black ICE are much more pronounced than vanilla. Bad terrain, bad weather combined can reduce all movement to zero. In such situations sometimes the only thing to do is wait for the weather to clear. Movement speed and ETA is calculated on an hourly basis, so a long ETA and no speed will reset once the weather clears. In addition different units are affected differently by terrain in a more pronounced way. Tanks will bog down badly in marshes. A tank unit forced to retreat into a marsh is going to be out of the war for a long time. In this sense a certain amount of planning is required when conducting warfare in difficult terrain. Each unit will list its bonuses or penalties for each terrain type. It is well worth taking time to find out which units will fight best in a given terrain. E.g, Light Infantry, Marines, Engineers, Pack Artillery and Commandoes are the best units to send into Jungle

This is a small elite formation based around a skilled General. It can be added to a division as a powerful force multiplier and adds a special forces CA bonus. Some nations will have a number in the starting OOB, but only the a.i. is allowed to keep them. You will get an event that deletes all Battle Commanders.  You can keep up to three of them at a severe cost in officers. As the game progresses you may get historical events granting you additional Battle Commanders for a price in officers. There is a third possibility to get Battle Commanders: If your army achieves a major victory there is a chance of creating a new Battle Commander. This unit will appear in your construction queue.

In the nation tab of the technology screen you find this new tech. For every level of research you get access to an additional project. When you receive a new economic boost event and choose Use the opportunity for big business!  Each new project is then activated via a decisions notification. Each project will give a new Strategic Effect (have a look at your SE screen) and can trigger additional events in the later game. It is wise to choose carefully as some projects may not be suitable for your nation or strategy.

You can now purchase these special buildings via event. These events will trigger upon meeting certain conditions. For example a level 10 port is one condition needed to purchase dockyard facilities. You will also need a very large amount of resources, money," and supplies. After purchasing the new building there may be a wait of between 6 months to 2 years whilst it is built. Strategic Resources can also combine to give new Strategic Effects. For example Horses and Black Soil will give the Agricultural Giant strategic effect."

In the nation tab of the technology screen you find this new tech. For every level of research you get access to one additional monumental building. If you have the required resources you can initiate the construction of a new monumental building via a decision. Each monumental building will give a new Strategic Effect and give can trigger additional events in the later game. For example you can construct research labs, once you are at war and have built the Imperial University. But be aware that all of these building are related to your capital. If your capital falls the benefits will cease.

Broadcasting is one of the new nation techs. For every level of research you get access to an additional component of the broadcasting programme. If you have enough money you can activate every new component via a decision. Every programme will give a new Strategic Effect (have a look at your SE screen). Another new tech is the Secretary of public information and education. There are different areas of policy which cause random events to fire. These events will give negative modifiers for some time," but you can choose to have the Secretary attempt to control the situation. The higher the tech level the better his chance of success. Each attempt will cost money and if he fails the negative modifier can even last longer. Once he has success this situation wont occur again and will gain a new strategic effect. Depending on the number of battle fought and his level you may get a penalty."

Many new features of Black ICE need money, which can become tight. War bonds are a new source for your treasury. Its simple and fast way to generate a large amount of money, but have some negative side effects to the states stability. The higher the IC the more money will generate from war bonds. If you have constructed the Imperial Finance-Ministry you get even more.

One of the new challenges in Black ICE is the constant need to keep your population content along with managing any captured populations. Choosing to enable revolts will allow your own people to riot and shut down entire cities. You will need to send in the military to control the unrest. To this end the major nations all receive a strong policing force via event in the areas where riots and unrest are most likely to occur. The best way of managing this part of the game is to set up a new theatre with the policing units and define the entire area behind the frontlines and borders. Set this on full AI control along with militia, garrisons, cavalry, fascist militia, NKVD and any spare army troops.The larger the area the more troops you will need

The scale of airforce units is smaller in Black ICE. Each airforce unit represents something closer to a number of squadrons. This means that both the AI and the player will need to build and deploy much larger airforces. The key to gaining air control is to field a large interceptor force.an idea of how large can be seen in the Soviet airforce by 1941 often having approx. 200 interceptors alone. To maintain a large airforce you will also need to build more airfields and have an effective command and control. Developing a strong airforce command chain makes managing your airforce much easier.
Pending

Combined arms brigades are historical event triggered formations which form on the map when specific historical triggers are met. This typically will be the capture(or loss) of a certain province. The unit represents a rare and powerful combined arms mobile formation led by a historical leader.

Black ICE uses a different build structure to vanilla HOI3 and mods.Main brigades are more expensive and powerful. The AI uses a single main brigade and 3 suppoort units. One postitive of this is allowing the AI to have many more divisional assets to spread around the battlefield. This leaves the player facing a much more numerous enemy ready to launch more battles across mutiple fronts. .

The Economic war in Black ICE is expanded upon and given more options thanks to new event choices such as the yearly National Focus event, various money trading events and a range of new strategic effects, techs and country modifiers. Be prepared to micromanage your economy for better results to match your play style.

Many of the main fighting brigades in Black ICE are larger in size than vanilla. This means they will take more damage, but also burn through more MP in heavy fighting. Infantry is the backbone of your land army. Useful in any terrain, able to take and hold ground. they are slow moving, but require no fuel. A typical Infantry division is INF+INF+ART+AT
This unit is most useful in forests, jungles, and mountain terrian. They lack the heavy weapons and the overall strength of normal infantry. Use them with engineers, pack art, or commandoes.
This includes The French Foreign Legion and Italian Berslageri brigades. They are an much tougher opponent than normal Light Infantry
Badly trained and equipped. These are the low quality troops which are cheap to use in desperate situations.Use them in a group or with whatever is availble in a desperate situation
Available to all fascist government types, these groups of politically indoctrinated men make poor frontline soldiers, but excellent partisan killers

Garrison Behind the lines guard units. Slow moving and too heavy to transport. These units are best left in place to portect VPs, cities, ports and resources. A typical garrison division might be GAR+GAR+AA
Attach this unit to your HQ units as a combination of ground and air defense as well as anti partisan abilites.

Fast moving infantry and heavy weapons transported by truck and carriers. This unit can keep up with armor and hold the ground the tanks have captured. Expensive and requires a reliable fuel supply. Typically use 2 Motorised brigades and any combination of fast moving supports

Regular infantry with some truck transport able to shuttle the infantry about. Faster then normal infantry, and requires a reliable fuel supply. Depending on the tech levels this unit can have different speed  and stats. Combine 2 x Semi with supports which match the speed and intended use

Powerful armored infantry transported in halftracks and carriers. Expensive and fuel guzzlers, these units are the peak of infantry warfare. Mech+Mech any combination of mobile and armored support units

Harking back to another time, Cavalry still have a role to play in WW2 warfare. Reasonably fast and especially suitable for marsh and terrian where vehicles fail, cavalry are also decent partisan hunters. A typical divison might be CAV+CAV+Recon-cav
Tank Riding infantry support battalion useful for adding to armored and mobile divisions where extra infantry is required.
Infantry support battalion carried in half-tracks and carriers. This unit is a much cheaper varient of the full mech brigade.

Fast and relatively cheap tank units. The benefits to this unit is in its speed and lower fuel consumption. Rapidly outclassed by medium armor, it does however have a role to play to expliot breakthroughs. In combination with recon units this is a potent rapid moving division to send into a breech.
Slow moving and not designed to fight other tanks, this unit is designed to operate closely with the infantry as a heavy support unit.
The backbone of an strong armored force. Medium Armor is the tank of choice for armored thrusts. A typical division might be ARM+MOT+AC+TD
A powerful, expensive and fuel guzzling support unit. These are the big slow heavy tanks which provide extra power in defense or to smash and enemy line
A late war advanced tank this unit is the end of the line in heavy tank design.
Less expensive support battalion variant of the armor brigade. Useful for adding an extra tank force to mobile formations without the added expense.
Based off light tank designs, these units are useful for supporting marines and infantry in sea invasions or crossing rivers.
Gained via event OOB only these are lower quality tank units using captured equipment. Useful when tanks are limited, or behind the lines, weaker allies, and quiet parts of the front.
The queen of the battlefield. Artillery is a slow but powerful support for infantry divisions. Don't leave home without it !
A combination of garrison and heavy artillery. This unit is not designed to move apart from Strategic Deployment. Use it to boost garrisons, defend and attack forts and urban centres.
Artillery towed by truck and half-track. This unit is a useful addition to mobile and armored divisions
Fully tracked artillery able to move faster than motorised artillery
Specialised artillery which is light and able to be transported into more difficult terrain. Best used with Lt Infantry and special forces divisions.
Artillery which can be flown in via gliders or large transport planes. Used in combination with airlanding infantry and paratroops.
Designed to stop tanks dead, this unit, along with artillery, is standard issue for infantry divisions.
Use this whenever control of the air is not assured. Enemy bombers can quickly make a mess of even the most elite and experienced troops.
AT guns are too slow to support mobile and armored formations. This unit has its guns towed by trucks and half-track.
AA weapons designed to keep up with mobile and armored divisions
Fully tracked AA guns which can go wherever the tanks and Mech units go
A light AT gun attached to a tracked vehicle. This unit can provide some much needed AT bost to mobile and armored formations at a fraction of the cost
As the tanks become better armored the AT weapons must also up gun. This unit is designed to take on medium tanks in ambush situations
Designed as heavy tank killers, this is the ultimate in tracked AT gun design.

Initially designed to support infantry in the same manner as infantry tanks, assault guns soon proved their worth as potent tank killers and cheap substitutes for tanks, especially in defensive situations.

As the war progressed it became clear that infantry units needed more powerful support weapons to hit fortified postions, and take on more heavily armored tanks. Heavy Assault guns are the ideal bunker buster with good AT abilities.
Fast moving and a bonus in terrain, armored cars are perfect for adding speed and movement bonuses to mobile and armored divisions

Weaker than armored cars, but considerably cheaper and fuel efficient, these are the ideal recon unit for any situation, especially in the early-to-mid war. Perfect for combining with HQ units for added mobility. This unit can also be transported by Gliders.

Ideally suited to cavalry formations and as a very cheap minor nation recon unit. These use no fuel and move very quickly in marshes and places where vehicles fail. Also a potent anti-partisan support unit.

A brigade of paratroops can be transported and paradropped into any province within air range. Gliders can carry 2 brigades or supporting units such as airborne artillery, commandos and motorcycle recon units.
Basically light infantry trained to land via glider planes. Airlanding infantry are more heavily armed than paratroops

Bascially light infantry with limited amphibious training and suited to being trasnported via ship. These units are useful for conducting amphibious invasions and be transported overseas in transports and invasion craft. They also fight well in Jungle terrain. A typical division may simply be composed of Naval infantry or perhaps N-INF+N-INF+ENG+Pack ART.

This unit covers the USMC and Japanese SNELF formations as well as some UK formations and some of the elite Soviet naval infantry units. With better amphibious and combat stats this is the unit of choice in the pacific island battles.
Ideally suited to warfare in mountainous terrain, mountain troops can be used in combination with light infantry, engineers, pack artillery and commandos.

Artic conditions and forests are suited to troops trained in the particular combat conditions of these snowy wilderness. Essentially light infantry which are trained for cold climate, ski troops work well with light infantry, mountain troops, commandos, engineers and pack artillery.

The perfect force multiplier for any situation. Commandos are expensive and take along time to build, many are given via event OOB and these will work with any brigade in any terrain or combat situation.

River crossings, difficult terrain, forts and urban battles are the Raison d'etre for engineers. These support brigades are expensive and take time to train, but are one of the most useful brigades in the mod. Terrain in Black ICE can be a formiddable opponent in itself.

Engineers crossed with tanks and armored assault weapons. These are one of the most highly specialised assault units in the game. Combine them with armor, mech and heavy armor or heavy assault guns to take out any forts or the most tenacious urban defenders.
Ever wondered how to control partisan uprisings easily  How many aircraft you should aim to build  The Quick tips section of the guide might help
Slightly larger, with better morale and toughness than their Wehrmacht counterparts. SS infantry will fight longer and harder but may suffer greater losses in doing so.You can now build this SS unit

Powerful mobile infantry unit. It is more expensive and uses more fuel and supplies than the Wehrmacht counterpart. Useful for spearhead formations and holding hard won ground until reinforcements arrive.You can now build this SS unit
SS Gebrigsjaeger are especially useful for the anti-partisan war in the occupied Balkans and Northern Europe.You can now build this SS unit
Especially useful as partisan hunters in the wastelands of occupied Russia.You can now build this SS unit

One of the most powerful units in the game, SS Panzer Brigades are also very expensive and require large amounts of fuel and supplies. Use them in the elite spearhead formations.You can now build this SS unit
A support brigade which is a combination of assault guns and tank destroyers for SS Panzer and Motorised/Mech units.You can now build this SS unit
Very expensive, both to build and supply. These are the famed SS Tiger Battalions. Useful in breakthrough formations or as firebrigades in defense.You can now build this SS unit

SS Mechanized is one of the most powerful infantry units in the game. Very expensive to build and supply, these units can be used alongside otehr SS brigade types to create extremely powerful, if expensive, combat formations.You can now build this SS unit

The Nanjing Massacre

A few weeks ago, our war planes began bombing Nanjing, concentrating their efforts on the downtown areas, which were most densely populated by civilians. Knowing that our troops were en route toward the city, the people panicked and tried to flee. When Japanese ground forces reached Nanjing, they were met with only minimal resistance from overwhelmed and fatigued Chinese military units. Four days later, with us attacking the city from all angles, the Chinese forces were routed. Fearing the consequences of surrender, Chinese soldiers donned civilian clothing and retreated into the city. According to some of our military commanders, various atrocities against the civilian population of Nanjing occured during the following weeks. There are rumours of 200.000 - 300.000 dead. The news of the massacre will now hit the world and probably deteriorate our relations with the Democratic countries significantly.
That many

Sir, the Imperial Navy Admiral Staff have started the work to convert 14 merchant ships to be added to our Navy as Armed Merchant Cruisers!  The Kinjosan Maru was the first of 14 Tokusetsu Junyôkan, Special Cruisers," Armed Merchant Cruisers (AMC's) or "Raiders", to enter service for the Imperial Japanese Navy during WW2.  Early December '41 it joined the 'Kure Tokusetsu Junyokan Sentai', Kure Special Cruiser Squadron," with Bangkok Maru and Saigon Maru for mine laying operations in the "inner sea" area.  The Kinjosan Maru was lightly armed with 4x120mm (4","7") guns", 1x7,7mm AA-MG," and 400 mines."

The Gokoku Maru was the last merchant to be converted to an Armed Merchant Cruiser by the Imperial Japanese Navy during WW2. It was also the heaviest armed of them with: 8x140mm (5,5) guns, 2x76mm (3) AA-guns, 4x25mm AA-guns, 2x twin 13,5mm AA-MG," 4x53cm (21") torpedo tubes and 2 Kawanishi E7K2 recon floatplanes."

The Asaka Maru Class (Asaka and Awata) was armed with 4x140mm (5,5) gun, 2x twin 25mm AA, 8 to 10 13,2mm MG's, 3x 7,7-mm MGs. 4x533mm (21) torpedo tubes. The 24th Special Cruiser Squadron (24 Tokusetsu Kunyokan Sentai) was commanded by Rear Admiral (later Vice Admiral) Takeda," Moriji. The Hokoku Maru Class (Hokoku and Aikoku) was armed with 4x152mm (6") gun", 2x76mm AA, 1x13,2mm AA-MG," 2x533mm (21") torpedo tubes and carried 2 Kawanishi E7K2 'Alf' floatplanes."

The Kinryu Maru was armed with 4x152mm (6)/50cal guns, 2x13mm AA guns, 2x 53cm torpedo tubes and 1 floatplane for reconnaissance and observation tasks.
