The two biggest guns shelling the beachhead at Anzio were a pair of huge," 280mm guns mounted on railroad carriages and hidden in tunnels in the Alban Hills. The Germans had named one of the guns Leopold and the other "Robert"," but the GIs on the beachhead simply referred to them as Anzio Annie and the Anzio Express, the latter because the sound of the shells flying overhead caused some soldiers to imagine a runaway train roaring through the sky. The one which the Germans called Leopold"," was located southeast of Rome near the Ciampino Airfield. The other, which they called Robert"," was situated several miles to the south of Ciampino at Frattocchio Station.

The 38 cm Siegfried K (E) (K - Kanone (cannon), E - in Eisenbahnlafette (on railroad mounting)) was a railway gun developed by Germany during World War II. Originally designed as the main armament of the Bismarck-class battleships, some surplus guns were transferred to the Army for use on coast-defense duties.

The 38 cm Siegfried K (E) (K - Kanone (cannon), E - in Eisenbahnlafette (on railroad mounting)) was a railway gun developed by Germany during World War II. Originally designed as the main armament of the Bismarck-class battleships, some surplus guns were transferred to the Army for use on coast-defense duties.

The Langer Gustav was a long cannon with 52 centimetre caliber and a 43 metre barrel. It was intended to fire super-long-range rocket projectiles weighing 680 kilograms to a range of 190 kilometres. This gave it the range to hit London from Calais, France. It was never completed after being damaged during construction by one of the many RAF bombing raids on Essen.

Three BL 13.5 inch /45 Mark V guns, named Gladiator, Piece Maker and Scene Shifter, were mounted on railway chassis during World War II for use as railway guns. Scene Shifter re-used a railway truck which had carried a BL 14 inch Railway Gun in the First World War. In 1940 these guns were issued to the Royal Marine Siege Regiment at Dover in Kent to bombard German batteries and shipping in the Calais area. They could be stored in railway tunnels when not in use to protect them from attack.

In late 1940 one 18-inch howitzer was mounted on the railway mounting nicknamed Boche Buster" which had been used in World War I to carry a 14-inch gun. It was deployed at Bishopsbourne in Kent on the Elham to Canterbury Line as a coast defence gun as a precaution against possible German invasion

The 14-inch M1920 railway gun was the last large caliber railway gun to be deployed by the U.S. Army. It was an upgrade of the Navy 14"/50 caliber railway gun. This was meant to build a better railway gun", from past mistakes.

The Obukhovskii 12"/52 Pattern 1907 gun was a Russian and Soviet 305 mm (12 inch) naval gun. It was the most powerful gun to be mounted aboard battleships of the Imperial Russian Navy", and was also employed by both nations in shore batteries and railway guns.

The Type 90 240 mm railway gun, Kyurei-shiki nijyuyon-miri Resshaho, was a large caliber railroad gun acquired by the Imperial Japanese Army from the French arms manufacturer Schneider in 1930. The Type 90 designation was given to this gun as it was accepted in the year 2590 of the Japanese calendar (1930).It was the only railroad gun in Japanese service.

Italy planned a class of four dreadnought battleships to succeed the two ships of the Andrea Doria class to be armed with 381 mm (15 in) guns to match the British Queen Elizabeth class. The Italians ordered thirty guns in 1913, ten each from Ansaldo-Schneider, Armstrong-Pozzvoli, and Vickers-Terni. Seven of the Ansaldo guns were transferred to the Army and turned into railroad guns.
Information Events about the new buildings in BICE. Each building is produced at the province level and can be built up to level 10 per province.

These include Steel Refinaries, Coal Mines, Oil Rigs, and Rares Extraction.

 Resource Buildings need to be constructed in the related resource province if available - Steel Factory in a Steel Province, Oil Rig in an Oil Province, Coal Mines in an energy province, rare extraction in a rare materials province. Each level of Resource building increases the production of that province by a percentage 

Steel Refinary 1% province metal boost 

Coal Mine 1% province energy boost 

Rares Extraction 1% Rares boost 

Oil Rig 1% Crude oil boost

These include Oil Refineries, Manufacturing Plants, and Heavy Industry. 

Oil Refineries increase Oil to fuel conversion by 1% per level. 

Manufacturing Plants increase supply production by 2% per level. 

Heavy Industry increases the province IC by 25% per level. For example a level 10 IC province with 1 HIC will have 12.5IC

These include Tank Factories, Aircraft Factories, Armaments Factories, and Shipyards. 

Tank Factories reduce build time of Lt Armor, Med Armor, Hv Armor, Inf Tanks, and SS/Guards versions by 0.5% per level of building. 

 Armament Factories reduce build time of all non armor land units by 0.5%. 

Aircraft Factories reduce buildtime of airunits by 1% per level. 

Ship Yards reduce buildtime of naval units by 1% per level

These include Military Training Grounds, Research Centres, Police Stations,Pillboxes, and Beach Defences. 

Pillboxes provide 20% of the fort penalty (compared to 80% by the Fortress building). 

Beach Defences provide 20% of the fort penalty on coastal provinces. 

Training Grounds increase new unit experience by 2pts per level. 

Research Centres provide a research effiecency bonus of 1% per level. 

Police Stations decrease revolt risk in a province by 5%, this flows into neighbouring provinces.

These include Hospitals, Rail Terminous, Urban centres, Snow, Mud, and Monsoon effects. 

Hospitals provide a bonus to casualty trickleback of 5% per level. They cannot be built or repaired though can be captured. 

Rail Terminous provide a supply throughput bonus of 1% per level. They cannot be built or repaired but can be captured. 

Urban Centres increase the manpower in a province by 5% per level. They cannot by built, or repaired, but can be captured. 

 Snow provides a 9.2% defence bonus per level. The amount of snow varies according to the time of year and area on the map. 

Mud provides a 13.8% defence bonus per level. The amount of mud varies according to the time of year and the area on the map. 

Monsoon provides a 11.5% defence bonus per level. The Monsoon varies in strength according to time of year and area on the map.

MAN enterprises supplied diesel engines for submarines, tanks, cylinders for projectiles and artillery of every description. MAN also produced gun parts, including Mauser K98 rifle bolts. Their Waffenamt code was WaA53," and ordnance code was "coc".The MAN works in Nuremberg were often the target of massive bombing attacks during World War II", because 40 percent of all Panther tanks built in Germany were produced there

Krupp received its first order for 135 Panzer I tanks in 1933.All early models of Panzer IV were manufactured by Krupp but from the Ausf F production was extended to Nibelungenwerke and later also included Vomag. In December 1943 Krupps factory was diverted to manufacture the Sturmgeschütz IV (beginning in January 1944), and in the spring of 1944 the Vomag factory began production of the Jagdpanzer IV, leaving Nibelungenwerke as the only plant still assembling the Panzer IV.

Georg Christian Carl Henschel founded the factory in 1810 at Kassel. His son Carl Anton Henschel founded another factory in 1837. In 1848, the company began manufacturing locomotives. The factory became the largest locomotive manufacturer in Germany by the 20th century. Henschel built 10 articulated steam trucks, using Doble steam designs, for Deutsche Reichsbahn railways as delivery trucks. Several cars were built as well, one of which became Hermann Göring's staff car. In 1935 Henschel was able to upgrade its various steam locomotives to a high-speed Streamliner type with a maximum speeds of up to 140 km/h (87 mph) by the addition of a removable shell over the old steam locomotive. Early in 1935, Henschel began manufacturing Panzer I tanks.

In 19391940 Henschel began large-scale production of the Panzer III. Henschel was the sole manufacturer of the Tiger I and Tiger II. In 1945, the company had 8000 workers working in two shifts each of 12 hours

Alkett (Altmärkische Kettenwerk GmbH) was a major manufacturer of armored vehicles for the Wehrmacht during World War II. The main factory was located in Berlin-Borsigwalde on the Breitenbachstraße. Altmärkischen Kettenwerke performed as designer, manufacturer, and partially exclusive licensee of some of the main armored fighting vehicles of the Wehrmacht. At its peak 10-20 AFV were produced everyday by between 3000-4000 workers.

When Germany took over the western half of Czechoslovakia in 1939, Skoda became an arsenal for the German military, producing Panzer 35(t) tanks, Jagdpanzer 38(t) tank destroyers, K1 howitzers, among other equipment and weapons.

Historically, Speer became minister of armaments and munitions in 1942, a title enlarged the following year to minister of armaments and war production, when he was charged not only with armaments production, transportation, and placement but also with final authority over raw materials and industrial production.

Detroit Arsenal Tank Plant (DATP) was the first manufacturing plant ever built for the mass production of tanks in the United States. Established in 1940 under Chrysler. By the end of the war, this facility built 22,234 tanks, over one quarter of the tanks produced in the US.
This plant was opened in 1942. It originally built tanks for World War II as the Grand Blanc Fisher Tank Arsenal, and is still sometimes called the Tank Plant.

ALCOs involvement with tanks began in November 1940 when the U.S. Armys Ordnance Department contracted with two heavy engineering companies, American Locomotive and Baldwin Locomotive, to produce 685 and 535 examples of the M3 tank. ALCO developed and was the largest manufacturer of the M7 Priest self-propelled howitzer. American Locomotive was also involved in production of the M36 tank destroyer.

During World War II Baldwin's contributions to the war effort included not only locomotives and switchers but also tanks. Baldwin was one of the manufacturers of several variants of the M3 tank (M3 Lee, M3A2, M3A3, M3A5) and later the M4 Sherman.

MIAG produced electric vehicles from 1936 to 1938, including forklifts and cranes.During the Second World War MIAG was involved in the program for the manufacture of assault guns and tank destroyers. Production of the Jagdpanther began in January 1944 at MIAG where it was produced until the wars end. In November of 1944 production began at MNH, and in December 1944 at MBA

As early as 1885 the company traded as Vogtländische Maschinenfabrik AG, or VOMAG. It became a world leading machine maker, and from 1915 it moved into vehicle manufacture with the Regeldreitonner lorry of which more than a thousand examples were produced by the end of the First World War. In 1940 VOMAG was commissioned by the German army to conduct tank repairs, and to begin tank manufacture.

VOMAG initially had six buildings for tank production but in 1941 expanded again with the construction of a huge Panzerhalle which was finally completed in 1943. VOMAG initially produced the SdKfz9 heavy half-track and the Panzer IV Ausf F and then Ausf G. VOMAG became one of the largest tank manufacturers in the Third Reich. In October 1943 VOMAG produced a prototype of the Jagdpanzer IV in competition with Alkett and won the contract for its production. VOMAG was solely responsible for the standard Jagdpanzer IV (though Alkett later produced a hybrid version in small numbers) and eventually produced at least 1600 examples of all models.

The Nibelungen works was the largest and most advanced tank assembly plant of the German Reich. In the plant, which was run by Steyr-Daimler-Puch, over half of all Panzer IV tanks were produced up until the end of World War II. Under the German four-year plan, after the annexation of Austria, an armaments centre was created in the area of Linz, which included, among other things, the manufacture of armour plates at the Upper Danube Ironworks for the Nibelungen works which was itself responsible for the final assembly of tanks. The latter resulted from plans from 1939 to build an arms factory at the railway junction town of Saint Valentin for 65 million Reichsmark. The official opening took place in 1942.

In the Breslau factory two types of caterpillar tractors were manufactured for the construction industry, and for forestry and agriculture. Products included tractors and diesel engines for stationary use and for shipbuilding, but in 1937 as part of the preparations for war a department for special vehicles was created. During the war years FAMO produced the Wespe at its Breslau and Warsaw factories, and was also involved in production of the Marder II.

On June 24,1941, the Council for Evacuation was appointed. Ten days later, Voznesenskii, director of five-year planning, was authorized to commence movement of industry and workers to the east. Local committees used the five-year plan structure with 3,000 agents controlling the movement. Large scale evacuation of industrial plants began in August 1941 and continued until end of the year.

After the German invasion of 1941, Stalin ordered hundreds of factories in Ukraine and western Russia to be evacuated east. The KhPZ Factory No. 183 in Kharkiv was moved to Nizhny Tagil by rail, and merged with the Dzerzhinsky Works, to form the Stalin Ural Tank Factory No. 183. During the second world war it became the largest producer of tanks in the world, including the T-34.

The Chelyabinsk Tractor plant was a project of the First Five Year Plan. The plant was founded in 1933, the first product was a 60 hp tracked tractor fueled by petroleum ether (Benzine). In 1937 the factory produced its first diesel-powered vehicle C-65. By 1940 the plant had produced 100,000 tractors. During World War II seven other industrial entities (including most of Leningrad's Kirov Plant, and 15,000 of its workers.) were either wholly or partially relocated to Chelyabinsk, the resulting enterprise, commonly known as ('Tankograd', or 'Tank City'). The work force increased to 60,000 workers by 1944, from 25,000 during non-military production
column3: during the conflict the works produced 18,000 tanks, and 48,500 tank diesel engines as well as over 17million units of ammunition.

column2: Comrades ! We have laid plans to destroy and sabotage the Leningrad Tank factory to prevent it falling undamaged into the fascist invaders hands.
Comrades ! We have laid plans to destroy and sabotage the Stalingrad Tank factory to prevent it falling undamaged into the fascist invaders hands.

Another T-34 plant was located at Omsk-Lenin Plant No. 174. before the war the Lenin plant in Omsk had employed 5000 workers making tractors. In 1941 additional machines and men came from Plant No. 174 in Leningrad. The plant first made T-60 light tanks but soon switched to producing T-34s. By 1944,15,000 workers were producing up to 20 T-34s per day and 200 per month.

The Kuibyshev Factory No.38 in Kirov was the secon major light tank factory. The Prewar Kolomensky Locomotive Works No.38 began making T-60s in July 1941 and continued until it was evacuated to Kirov in the fall of 1941. More men and machines came from Plant No.37 to form the new factory. In October 1943 light tank production ceased and the SU-76 production began. By June 1944, monthly production totaled 550 Su-76s, 2700 trucks, 350 armored cars with 8000 workers.
The Bolsheviks have destroyed the Tank Factory in Leningrad, preventing the Reich from capturing the machinary for our own use.
The damned Reds destroyed the Tank Factory in Stalingrad before being defeated. We are unable to use the machinary for our own uses.

It seems traitors still lurk within our military ! We have uncovered hundreds of plots by our officers to either overthrow our glorious leader, sabotage equipment, or help the enemies of the State. These traitors will be rounded up and dealt with. Long live the revolution ! Long live Stalin !

During the war, Nuffield Mechanizations was engaged in military production. Among their activities was production of the Liberty L-12 engine for use in British tanks of the period. In 1939 one of their subsidiaries was given the opportunity to take part in production of the Covenanter tank then being designed but opted to develop their own version of the design which became the Crusader tank. Nuffield Mechanizations followed this with the Cavalier tank which used the Liberty engine as well. Though the tank was put into production the power of the Liberty engine was limited and because of the increase in tank weight the Cavalier was not used in combat. The last tank the Liberty engine was produced for was the A27L Centaur tank, effectively an underpowered Cromwell tank. Nuffield Mechanizations' plants were in Drews Lane, Ward End, Birmingham and Gosford Street Coventry.

During the war, Leyland Motors along with most vehicle manufacturers was involved in war production. Leyland built the Cromwell tank at its works from 1943 as well as medium/large trucks such as the Leyland Hippo and Retriever. The Lancashire Steam Motor Company was renamed Leyland Motors in 1907 when they took over Coulthards of Preston, who had been making steam wagons since 1897. They also built a second factory in the neighbouring town of Chorley
In the Second World War, Metro built tanks again, including the Valentine tank and Light Tank Mk VIII.
The company built tanks (including the A10 Cruiser, Churchill tank, Cromwell tank and Challenger),plus Hamilcar gliders in 1939-1945.

From 1939 the works was mostly concerned with the war effort, becoming involved in the development and production of the Matilda tank. From 1943 large orders were received from the Ministry of Supply for locomotives, 390 Austerity 2-8-0s and fifty Austerity 0-6-0 saddle tanks.

Royal Ordnance Factories (ROFs) was the collective name of the UK government's munitions factories in and after World War II. ROF Cardiff, was developed along Ty Glas Road to take the explosives from Bridgend and produce tank and anti-tank guns. Air defences against paratroopers were placed in nearby fields, but this was strengthened in 1941 when the Royal Air Force established both a RAF Regiment base and a glider training facility. In 1943 the United States Army began using the facilities to hold troops and undertake local training, including basic flight in Tiger Cubs. The Americans left in June 1944 as the Allies prepared for D-Day.

ROF Dalmuir started production as a Royal Ordnance Factory under the control of the Ministry of Supply, it opened on 16 January 1941. In August 1941 it was handed over to William Beardmore and Company to run as an Agency Factory, and it returned to ROF Management control in September 1944. It produced QF 3.75 inch AA and 4.5 inch gun anti-aircraft guns
ROF Fazakerley was a Royal Ordnance Factory rifle manufacturing plant in Fazakerley, Liverpool
column3: which manufactured weapons such as the Sten and Sterling submachine guns and LeeEnfield rifle during and after World War II.

column2: Royal Ordnance Factory Leeds, first opened in December 1915 and first opened as an ROF in January 1936, it was one of a number of Royal Ordnance Factories created at the start of the Second World War
ROF Maltby was a Royal Ordnance Factory rifle manufacturing plant in Maltby, South Yorkshire which manufactured weapons such as the LeeEnfield rifle and Sten submachine gun during World War II.

ROF Newport was World War II Royal Ordnance Factory that produced guns. Building started on a former allotment site off Corporation Road, Newport in April 1940.By December 1944, the number of guns produced rose to 12,132. The maximum monthly output of the Factory was 722 guns in January 1943.
Nottingham had two main production lines during the war
column3: the 3.7-inch medium anti-aircraft gun and the Bofors 40 mm gun. For the latter, Nottingham made the mobile mounts for the British Army from 1938 onwards, and was the main producer of mountings for British ships, including the Stabilised Tachymetric Anti-Aircraft Gun, STAAG. The 2 Pounder anti-tank gun was made at Nottingham from 1937 to 1939. The BL 5.5-inch Medium Gun (194042) and the 17 pounder gun, including conversions of the Sherman tank into the 17 pdr armed Sherman Firefly. The hull and suspension units for the first prototype A41 tank, later to named as the Centurion tank, were built at Nottingham.

column2: ROF Patricroft was opened during World War II to supplement the work of the Royal Arsenal, Woolwich. Some 3,000 men and women were employed at ROF Patricroft during the war. Parts for the Bofors 40 mm gun were manufactured. Other buildings on the site were used to fabricate welded parts, particularly oil tanks to enable steam locomotives to run on oil instead of coal.
The factory was built in 1940 and employed over 2,000 people during the war years. The ROF manufactured aircraft guns during and after the War until closure in 1958 and was a large employer in Poole
With the Fall of France, Germany gained control over the French Industry.

The Industrial Capacity of our Armaments Factories needs improving to keep pace with the Army's demands. All non-armor land units will have increased production speeds. We can either spend valuable resources to build a series of 10 new factories or improve the production in our existing factories for a short time. New Factories will be created according to IC levels in Provinces. If you have enough IC you will gain all 10 factories from your chosen National Focus.

The economic side of our Industry should be examined and production increased. Supply production and possibly Heavy Industry is possible to be built. The amount depends on the total IC and capcity of the existing province IC. You need at least 7 IC in a province to gain a HIC (which will increase the production by 25 percent). Otherwise you can choose to make existing industry more effiecent.

The Industrial Capacity of our Tank Factories needs improving to keep pace with the Army's demands. All armor units will have increased production speeds. We can either spend valuable resources to build a series of 10 new factories or improve the production in our existing factories for a short time. New Factories will be created according to IC levels in Provinces. If you have enough IC you will gain all 10 factories from your chosen National Focus.

The Industrial Capacity of our Aircraft Factories needs improving to keep pace with the Airforce's demands. All air units will have increased production speeds. We can either spend valuable resources to build a series of 10 new factories or improve the production in our existing factories for a short time. New Factories will be created according to airbase levels in Provinces. If you have enough airbases you will gain all 10 factories from your chosen National Focus.

The Industrial Capacity of our Shipyards needs improving to keep pace with the Navy's demands. All naval units will have increased production speeds. We can either spend valuable resources to build a series of 10 new shipyards or improve the production in our existing shipyards for a short time. New shipyards will be created according to naval base levels in Provinces. If you have enough naval bases you will gain all 10 shipyards from your chosen National Focus.
This will allow a variety of tank, armament, aircraft factories and shipyards to be built

Increasing the amount of hospitals will increase our casaulty trickleback, thus saving on manpower losses. We might also gain a rail terminous for better supply throughput, a new training ground for more unit experience, or an urban expansion for greater manpower growth in that province.
Increasing the amount of Research Labs will provide a research effiecency bonus.

The First Happy Time was a phase of the Battle of the Atlantic during which German Navy U-boats enjoyed significant success against the British Royal Navy and its allies. It started almost immediately after France was conquered by Germany, bringing the German U-boat fleet closer to the British shipping lanes in the Atlantic. From July 1940 to the end of October, 282 Allied ships were sunk off the north-west approaches to Ireland for a loss of 1,489,795 tons of merchant shipping

The Second Happy Time, also known among German submarine commanders as the American shooting season, was the informal name for a phase in the Second Battle of the Atlantic during which Axis submarines attacked merchant shipping along the east coast of North America.During this period, Axis submarines sank 609 ships totaling 3.1 million tons and the loss of thousands of lives, mainly those of merchant mariners, against a loss of only 22 U-boats.

Snow will start to affect combat in Northern Europe, The Alps, Soviet Union, China and the Northern USA,Canada. Attacking will become more difficult and require greater use of Airpower to dislodge the enemy

Snow will significantly affect combat in Northern Europe, The Alps, Soviet Union, China and the Northern USA,Canada. Attacking will be much more difficult and require even greater use of Airpower to dislodge the enemy
Snow will make combat very difficult in Northern Europe, The Alps, Soviet Union, China and the Northern USA,Canada. Attacking will will be almost impossible in places
Snow begins to melt in Northern Europe, The Alps, Soviet Union, China and the Northern USA,Canada. Attacking will become easier until the thaw results in mud
Snow begins to melt in Northern Europe, The Alps, Soviet Union, China and the Northern USA,Canada. Attacking will become easier until the thaw results in mud
The worst of the Snow melts in Northern Europe, The Alps, Soviet Union, China and the Northern USA,Canada. Attacking will become easier until the thaw results in mud
Snow has mostly melted in Northern Europe, The Alps, Soviet Union, China and the Northern USA,Canada. Attacking will become easier until the thaw results in mud

The Monsoon Rains begin across South East Asia and the Pacific. The extreme wet makes attacking in any terrian very difficult. Coastal provinces and Jungle can be very difficult to disloge enemies from
The Monsoon Rains intensifies across South East Asia and the Pacific. The extreme wet makes attacking in any terrian very difficult. In most situations attacking will be futile in the floods
The Monsoon Rains begin to clear across South East Asia and the Pacific. The flooding still makes attacking in any terrian difficult.
The Dry Season begins across South East Asia and the Pacific. The terrian dries out and attacking will become much easier.

Mud has began to affect combat.Regions affected include Northern Europe, Spain, Italy, North Africa, and Eastern Europe. Russia in particular has a notorious mud season. Attacking in the mud makes combat very difficult. Airpower is the key to destroying the enemy during this time
Mud starts to dry up. Attacking in the mud will still be difficult.

Mud badly affects combat.Regions affected include Northern Europe, Spain, Italy, North Africa, and Eastern Europe. Russia in particular has a notorious mud season. Attacking in the mud makes combat very difficult.
The Mud finally dries up. Attacking the enemy will nolonger be affected by mud in most places.

Mud has began to affect combat.Regions affected include Northern Europe, Spain, Italy, North Africa, and Eastern Europe. Russia in particular has a notorious mud season. Attacking in the mud makes combat very difficult. Airpower is the key to destroying the enemy during this time
Mud starts to dry up. Attacking in the mud will still be difficult.

Mud badly affects combat.Regions affected include Northern Europe, Spain, Italy, North Africa, and Eastern Europe. Russia in particular has a notorious mud season. Attacking in the mud makes combat very difficult.
The Mud finally dries up. Attacking the enemy will nolonger be affected by mud in most places.
With France gone, Germany turns it's eyes to Britannia, the Irish are also threatened by the Nazi menace, we should make a compromise, give them Unity for Irish allegiance.
The British have asked us to join the Allies and fight the war against the Axis, in return for Irish Unity.

The Australian people query whether we should rely so heavily on the British Royal Navy and Singapore garrison, with the recent events in the world, should we not think about militarising a standing army of some sort?
The White Australia Policy of 1901 no longer truly belongs in our multi-cultural time, perhaps it is time to change our policy?
With war occurring, should we maintain our multi-cultural attitude although it may effect morale?
After the Great War, German New Guinea was transferred to Australia by the League of Nations for administration, should we merge Papua & New Guinea into one state and even grant independence?
War with the Axis will demand a united Allied force, Commonwealth members are suggesting the annexation of Papua New Guinea to achieve this, who knows if they will approve though.
War with the Axis will demand a united Allied force, Commonwealth members are suggesting the annexation of Papua New Guinea to achieve this.
Australia regret granting our sovereignty and wish to take our lands back, should we let them do such a thing?
What should we do in response?
The Centennial Exhibition celebrated 100 hundred years since the signing of the Waitangi treaty in 1840, making the Maori tribes British subjects.

Opening of the Winter Olympics at Garmisch-Partenkirchen, Germany.  This gives us chance to show the world German Greatness. German skier Willy Bogner takes the Olympic oath during the opening ceremonies.  Generalmajor Eduard Dietl, a international competitive skier, helped organize many events.  A military patrol competition will be held for the first time (a precursor to the biathlon).
Alpine skiing made its first appearance in the winter Olympics with German athletes Franz Pfnür won men's alpine and Christl Cranz won women's alpine events.
We must finish preparations for the 1936 Winter Olympics at Garmisch-Partenkirchen in Bavaria, Germany.
To entertain our foreign guests and show off German culture we will have show with dancing girls.  German womanhood will be on display.

The Peenemünde Army Research Center was one of five military proving grounds under the Army Weapons Office. On April 2,1936, the Reich Air Ministry paid 750,000 Reichsmark to the town of Wolgast for the whole Northern peninsula of the Baltic island of Usedom. The site had been suggested by Wernher von Braun's mother as 'just the place for you and your friends'. By the middle of 1938, the Army facility had been separated from the Luftwaffe facility and was nearly complete, with personnel moved from Kummersdorf. The Army Research Center (Peenemünde Ost) consisted of Werk Ost and Werk Süd, while Werk West was the Luftwaffe Test Site.

The Commonwealth Aircraft Corporation (CAC) was an Australian aircraft manufacturer. The CAC was established in 1936, to provide Australia with the capability to produce military aircraft and engines.During its existence the Commonwealth Aircraft Corporation produced over 1700 aircraft of all types, including prototypes and aircraft assembled locally from imported components. Of these, almost 550 were examples of aircraft types wholly designed by the company.  The CAC became a fully owned subsidiary of Hawker de Havilland in 1985 and was renamed Hawker de Havilland Victoria Limited in 1986. This company was purchased by Boeing Australia in 2000.

The renowned Hoover Dam has finished construction, construction occurred for five years, between 1931 and 1936 during the Great Depression. It was built on the state border of Arizona and Nevada. The Dam had two official names, one named after President Hoover and one after the nearby Boulder Canyon, many Americans feltfrustrated that a man whom had nothing to do the dam was named after it, in 1947 the name was restored to Hoover to the vexation of many US citizens.

The 1936 Heat Wave effected all of North America and was one of the most severe heat waves in modern history, the death toll exceeded 5,000 in the United States alone. Many summer harvests were destroyed, drought occurred and many people suffered. Many high class areas had in-door ventilation and cooling, so many employed in rich businesses were uneffected. The Heat Wave lasted mainly till September.

On February 21st,1937, the Arrowbile developed by Waterman Arrowplane made it's first flight, it was a tailless aircraft intended for civilian use. It worked as a automobile on the ground and a plane in the air. It generated little consumer interest and only five were built. Many iterations were built in the later years, but never took hold. The last iteration was made in May 1957.

The war in Ethiopia has dragged on for alot longer then is wise. Our people are tired of the pointless fighting and many people are questioning the ability and skill of our military. The Leaque of Nations is also condemning the invasion in no uncertain terms. It is time to finish up this little adventure
Wein and Linz have recovered from severe economic downturn. Coal mines, Steel refinaries, and industry have increased output
Graz and Innsbruck have recovered from severe economic downturn. Coal mines, Steel refinaries, Armaments factories and industry have increased output

Annexing Austria before the historical date in 1938 will have its drawbacks. In 1936 the Austrian economy was in crisis. Industry was suffering and there remained much work todo to get the nation back on track. In 1937 and again in 1938 a number of events trigger for Austria where IC, coal mines, steel refineries, and armaments factories come online. As Germany, you have to decide to leave Austria alone to first recover or miss out on these new economic building programes and be forced to build up Austria yourself.

The Reichskolonialbund or Reich Colonial League was formed in 1936, but it's role was to organise plans for occupying German colonies lost in the Great War and new colonies. The organisation managed French and Belgian colonies in Brussels and Paris. In 1943, the organisation was disillusioned due to it's insignificance later in the war. Should we fund them? Note - Funding the Reichskolonialbund costs money, but so does them coring colonies, so be sure to have enough money!

A bill has been proposed for the conscription of unmarried men into the CMF. Historically in 1939, conscription was introduced for unmarried men aged 21, unlucky to be that age in 1939, these men would train for three months in the CMF and would only serve in Australia or Australian territory such as Papua New Guinea. The issue of conscription wasn't a divided issue as it was in the Great War, so policies such as this one did not cause extensive controversy.

In the Great War, the issue of conscription divided Australia, in the Second World War with it's many threats has caused our nation to make the difficult decision to whether we will introduce conscription. Conscripting a large amount of our population will put strains on our industry and will distress our citizens, however to defend our shores, we will require manpower. If we wish to go all out on conscription, our economy, nation and research will suffer, but our army will gain the manpower it needs. Historically the Australian government introduced conscription for men 18 to 35 years of age, all single men aged 35-45 were required to join the CMF. Often professional and volunteer AIF troops teased conscripts espically CMF troops by calling them 'Chocos', men that 'melt' in battle.

A proposal has been made to the parliament to solve our manpower and industry issue, we can keep the males being conscripted, but use the women at home for the industry, In the Boer War and the Great War, women supported the nation, so why can't they now? We should disband our conservative attitudes and adapt to our situation by being liberal and mature regarding it. Historically women and children had to face many tribulations at home without their lovers and husbands, shortages of food, disputes and fear were common issues women and children faced at home in Australia. By 1942, women entered the male orientated workplaces in unseen numbers and although were payed fewer rates, did a splendid job for the war effort.

Should we allow women to set up their own organisations and possibly fund a few to support our front line, these organisations would sort out munitions, logistcs, repairs, signallers, transmitters, couriers, etc. Historically, many women set up independent and government funded organisations made to directly support the Australian Army, Navy and Airforce.

Women all over the nation are flocking to support our men in the air, they wish to support the RAAF by logistical, repairs, medical and other non-combative means. Historically the WAAAF was formed in 1941 and was the first female orientated organisation to support the Australian Armed Forces,27,000 women joined.

Women are attempting to form the Women's Royal Australian Naval Service or the WRANS, they will act as signallers, telegraphists, mechanics, coders, cooks, etc. Historically the WRANS was formed in April 1941 and more then 3000 women joined by the end of the war, WRANS personnel were not allowed to work out of Australia or on ships, their pay rates fluctuated throughout the war, but on average were payed two thirds of Royal Australian Navy personnel.

Women wish to work with our boys on the ground, they will be used to support logistics, medical, coastal defence, anti-aircraft, etc. Historically more then 24,000 women worked in the AWAS, the AWAS was the only non-exclusively medical female service to send women overseas in the Second World War. They served with Royal Australian Artillery brigades on searchlight, coastal defence and anti-aircraft batteries and they often worked in very isolated areas in Australia and it's dominions. In 1947 they were disbanded.

Australia must be united for us to be a worthy asset in the war effort, this can be done with censoring anti-war or anti-Australian statements in the media and control manpower in the industry, effectively making Australia a state-controlled economy for the population designated. Historically anti-Australian or war statements were censored in newspapers, radio, movies, etc. In 1941, Australians could not make anti-war comments in public. The Act gave power to the Australian government to order men and women to work in certain industries, although women were payed less then men, they were required to work at their designated job or 'offend' the act, however prosecution wouldn't occur without 'written consent of the Attorney-General, or the Minister of State for Defence, or a person thereto authorized in writing by the Attorney-General or the Minister of State for Defence.'

With our ally France surrendering, we must take more serious attitudes towards the war, let us stand united against the enemy! Historically Australia struggled to gain substantial amounts of volunteers in '39, however the Fall of France shocked the Australian government and populace and surges in enlistments occured, just 48,496 in June 1940.

The war has reached us, no longer do we have the luxury of being distant in a European War, we're now required to defend our shores! Historically when Japan went to war with the Allies, the war had reached Australia and recruitment boomed due to the looming threat of invasion.

We must decide whether to allow aboriginal and other ethnic minorities to be allowed to volunteer into the army and be applicable for conscription if the nation has it. In 1939 aboriginals weren't actually excluded from the Australian Armed Forces, perhaps due to the low numbers initially, however in 1940 the Defence Committee of Australia decided to exclude aboriginal enlistment due to it being 'neither necessary not desirable'. Aboriginals were not seen in large numbers in the AIF until the Japanese entry into the war where aboriginal exclusion was lessened. Many European Australians were fervently against aboriginal inclusion into the Australian Armed Forces due to the possibility that they would guide Japanese troops through Papua New Guinea and Australia and other assistance for personal gain.

The AIF was extremely biased towards European individuals, Aboriginals, Asians, Africans, etc were excluded from the Australian Armed Forces. Due to the White Australia Policy being dismantled, our Armed Forces has no room or encouragement for European bias.

Jääkäriprikaati was historically formed on summer of 1940 to be an mobile unit of the Finnish army in the upcoming war, commanded by colonel Ruben Lagus. The unit was posted as a part of commander-in-chiefs reserve at the start of the Continuation war. The unit fought in Karelia and was integrated into a new armored division in 1942.

Historically jääkäriprikaati and other units were combined to form an armored unit for the Finnish army in early 1942. The division was commanded by now a major general Ruben Lagus. The unit fought till the end of the Continuation war and in the Lapland war. In 1944 after ceasefire with Soviet union the division was reduced to an armored brigade, that is still active to this day.
The Aquila
Built as its first full fleet carrier the Aquila will bring glory to the Regia Marina. Let the Aquila fly and bring victory to Italy!
You can now order a new Industrial zone to be mapped out and made ready for new factories to possibly be contructed there by the National Focus options
The new industrial zone is ready. It will appear on the map in at least a 1 IC province with your nation's core, under your control and without an existing strategic resource.
A new commando force has been recruited and is placed in the build queue for production and training.

Stalin Escaped our glorious Panzers in the East. However the head of the Abwehr has proposed a daring mission. After a tip off from spies it seems Comrade Stalin has fled to Validovstok. We can launch a daring covert operation in the Far east to hunt and kill Stalin !. Our commandos will land on the coast north of Validovstok. Find Stalin and Kill him ! Good luck !
Brandeburg Gruppe Schwarz has located Stalin ! If the unit can survive 2 days we have a good chance of killing Stalin in his Far east HQ
Brandeburg Gruppe Weiss has located Stalin! If the unit can survive 2 days we have a good chance of killing Stalin in his Far east HQ

Sissi is a Finnish term for light infantry which conducts reconnaissance, sabotage and guerrilla warfare operations behind enemy lines.In wartime, an unspecified number of reservists assigned to Sissi battalions would deploy and operate as small groups up to company size. They are meant to stay behind and covertly operate against enemy forces in their area of responsibility even if regular friendly troops have been forced to retreat. Sissi battalions are part of Finnish Army local troops, unlike the jäger and armored brigades meant for operational use. Sissi units are considered as the elites of the Army conscripts. After the outbreak out of hostilities, five Sissi Battalions (Sissipataljoona) were formed from 'auxiliary personnel'. These battalions especially those of the latter type, were below their nominal strength in both men and weaponry. These units proved to be effective in using motti tactics in their native area with light infantry weapons and skis

In early October, the Legion was incorporated into the Heer as 373. (Wallonische) Infanterie Battalion. On 15 October, the Battalion was ordered to the front, to operate as a part of Army Group South currently advancing through Ukraine

The 97th Jäger Division was a German Infantry Division during World War II. It can trace its origins to the 97th Light Infantry Division which was formed in December 1940. It was then redesignated the 97th Jäger Division in July 1942. Shortly before this the 373. (Wallonische) Infanterie Battalion was also attached to the Division for a time.

In June 1943, after arranging the transfer with Heinrich Himmler, the Walloon Battalion was transferred to SS command. Around 1,600 volunteers who had been assembled in Meseritz to form the second Army battalion were also transferred to the SS training area at Wildflecken. Over the next few months, the Army Battalion was transformed into the SS Volunteer Sturmbrigade Wallonien, commanded by Oberst (now SS-Sturmbannführer) Lucien Lippert with SS-Hauptsturmführer Leon Degrelle as second-in-command. In October, the Wallonien was redesignated 5th SS Volunteer Sturmbrigade Wallonien, and was to be equipped as a fully motorized brigade with a complement of 250 vehicles. By November 1943, the Wallonien was deemed fit for combat and was sent to Ukraine to fight alongside the Wiking, now designated 5th SS Panzer Division Wiking.

The French Resistance is the name used to denote the collection of French resistance movements that fought against the Nazi German occupation of France and against the collaborationist Vichy régime during World War II. Résistance cells were small groups of armed men and women (called the Maquis in rural areas), who, in addition to their guerrilla warfare activities, were also publishers of underground newspapers, providers of first-hand intelligence information, and maintainers of escape networks that helped Allied soldiers and airmen trapped behind enemy lines. The men and women of the Résistance came from all economic levels and political leanings of French society, including émigrés
column3: academics, students, aristocrats, conservative Roman Catholics (including priests) and also citizens from the ranks of liberals, anarchists, and communists.

column2: Military Grade Trucks have less attrition, and better movement bonus then civilian vehicles. They are also more expensive to produce.

The reliable Blitz 3.6 three-ton version was used in large numbers by the German Wehrmacht armed forces throughout World War II. Derived variants included an elongated version and the four-wheel drive Blitz A. To cope with the bad road conditions and the rasputitsa mud seasons on the Eastern Front, a half-tracked Maultier (mule) SdKfz 3 version was built using tracks and suspension based on the Universal Carrier. Among others, these were used as service vehicles for the Messerschmitt Me 323 military transport aircraft.From 1935 until 1944 more than 130,000 Blitz trucks and chassis were produced.

The GMC CCKW was a 2 and half ton 6×6 U.S. Army cargo truck that saw heavy service in both World War II and the Korean War. The original "Deuce and a Half". The CCKW came in many variants", including open or closed cab, long wheel base (LWB 353) and short (SWB 352), and over a score of specialized models. By the end of production in 1945,562,750 CCKWs in all variants had been built, a total second only to the 'Jeep'.

In 1935, Bedford began the development of a 15 cwt truck for the British War Office. This entered service as the MW in 1939, and 65,995 examples had been built by the end of World War II in 1945. The MW appeared in a bewildering range of roles, as a water tanker, general duties truck, personnel carrier, petrol tanker, wireless truck and anti-aircraft gun tractor  among others.
Light Military vehicles are cheaper then trucks and have better movement bonus in rough terrian. Can also be carried in gliders and are useful with special forces units.

The Volkswagen Kübelwagen (literally, 'bucket car') was a light military vehicle designed by Ferdinand Porsche and built by Volkswagen during World War II for use by the German military (both Wehrmacht and Waffen-SS). Based heavily on the Volkswagen Beetle, it was prototyped as the Type 62, but eventually became known internally as the Type 82. When Volkswagen production ceased at the end of the war,50,435 Kübelwagen vehicles had been produced, and the vehicle had proven itself to be surprisingly useful, reliable, and durable.

The Willys MB (commonly known as a Jeep, formally as the U.S. Army Truck, 1/4 ton, 4x4) and the Ford GPW are four-wheel drive utility vehicles that were manufactured during World War II. During World War II, Willys produced 363,000 Jeeps and Ford some 280,000. Approximately 51,000 were exported to the U.S.S.R. under the Lend-Lease program.

The SPA-Viberti AS.42 Sahariana was an Italian reconnaissance car of World War II. The AS 42 Sahariana was developed by SPA-Viberti using the same chassis as the AB 41 armoured car, including its four-wheel steering, specifically for desert operations, primarily in a reconnaissance role.
Military halftracks have superior movement bonus and speed. But are expensive to produce and maintain.

German half-track tractors were used to tow anti-tank and field artillery pieces. The largest of these were also used by mechanical engineers to retrieve bogged down vehicles or perform repairs such as engine maintenance. A common feature of virtually all German World War II half-tracks was the so-called Schachtellaufwerk overlapped/interleaved roadwheel arrangement with a "slack track" system possessing no return rollers under the return run of track", used from the small Kettenkrad to the nine-tonne capacity Sd.Kfz. 9 vehicle, and most famously used on Henschel's Tiger I and MAN's Panther main battle tanks.

The SOMUA MCG was a half-track artillery tractor and recovery vehicle of the French forces during World War II.It was used to tow medium artillery pieces such as the 155 mm mle 1917 howitzer and the 105 mm mle 1936 field gun, as well as their specific ammunition trailers. Of this main version 345 were produced: 264 until 1 September 1939 and another 81 until the end of May. There was also a recovery version, fitted with a crane, to recover broken-down tanks, of which about 440 were produced.

The Yugoslav Partisans or the National Liberation Army, officially the National Liberation Army and Partisan Detachments of Yugoslavia, was Europe's most effective anti-Nazi resistance movement, often compared to the Polish resistance movement. The Yugoslav Resistance was led by the Communist Party of Yugoslavia during World War II. Its commander was Marshal Josip Broz Tito. The first communist military unit, the Sisak Brigade, was established on 22 June 1941, the day Nazi Germany invaded the Soviet Union.By late 1944, the total forces of the Partisans numbered 650,000 men and women organized in four field armies and 52 divisions, which engaged in conventional warfare.
Croatian Partisans were integral to overall Yugoslav Partisans
column3: by the end of 1943 Croatia proper, with 24% of the Yugoslav population, provided more Partisans than Serbia, Montenegro, Slovenia and Macedonia combined which collectively accounted for 59% of the Yugoslav population.

column2: In April 1941 the Germans, Italians and Hungarians invaded Yugoslavia leading to the swift collapse of the Yugoslav state and the surrender of the Yugoslav army. Many Serb detachments refused to surrender and took to the hills. In the wake of the invasion, the Chetniks were the first of the two resistance movements to be founded

Air Command Units are special HQ units designed to fly alongside of your aircraft units", and are for immersion and flavor only.  Air command units are used to provide custom historical counters for air units.\n\nThe major nations will receive various Air Command units via special date-driven events, although generic ones can also be built on the production screen.
'Sergeant York' debuts!

Sergeant York is a 1941 biographical film about the life of Alvin York, one of the most-decorated American soldiers of World War I. It is directed by Howard Hawks.\n\nYork refused, several times, to authorize a film version of his life story, but finally yielded to persistent efforts in order to finance the creation of an interdenominational Bible school. Cooper went on to win the Academy Award for Best Actor for his portrayal. The film also won for Best Film Editing and was nominated in nine other categories. The American Film Institute ranked the film 57th in the its 100 most inspirational American movies. It also rated Alvin York 35th in its list of the top 50 heroes in American cinema.
A real U.S. hero!
Luigi Pirandello has died!

Luigi Pirandello (1867.6.281936.12.10) was an Italian dramatist, novelist, poet and short story writer. He was awarded the 1934 Nobel Prize in Literature for his 'bold and brilliant renovation of the drama and the stage'. Pirandello's works include novels, hundreds of short stories and about 40 plays, some of which are written in Sicilian. Pirandello's tragic farces are often seen as forerunners of the Theatre of the Absurd. He was a committed fascist. In 1923, he had a personal meeting with Mussolini at Palazzo Chigi. In 1924, he sent a message to Mussolini where he asked to join the PNF. He often publicly criticized democracy, while he lauded Mussolini and its work as Duce of Italy.

On April 19,1943, the Warsaw ghetto uprising began after German troops and police entered the ghetto. Seven hundred and fifty fighters fought the heavily armed and well-trained Germans. The ghetto fighters were able to hold out for nearly a month, but on May 16,1943, the revolt ended. The Germans had slowly crushed the resistance.

The Warsaw Uprising was a major World War II operation by the Polish resistance Home Army to liberate Warsaw from Nazi Germany. The Uprising was timed to coincide with the Soviet Union's Red Army approaching the eastern suburbs of the city and the retreat of German forces. However, the Soviet advance stopped short, enabling the Germans to regroup and demolish the city while defeating the Polish resistance, which fought for 63 days with little outside support. The Uprising was the largest single military effort taken by any European resistance movement during World War II.

The Norwegian resistance to the occupation of Norway by Nazi Germany began after Operation Weserübung in 1940 and ended in 1945.During the war years, the resistance movement in occupied Norway lost 1433 members killed, of whom 255 were women.

The Four Year Plan was a series of economic measures initiated by Adolf Hitler, who put Hermann Göring in charge of it. Göring was made a Reich Plenipotentiary whose jurisdiction cut across the responsibilities of various cabinet ministries, including that of the Minister of Economics, the Defense Minister and the Minister of Agriculture. Under Goering the Four Year Plan was highly focussed upon readying the nation for war. Production of Iron and Steel had already been improved under Schachts leadership. This trend continued between 1936 and the outbreak of war. Likewise, Engineering and Chemical production continued to increase.  \n Important !!! PROMOTE GOERING TO ARMAMENT MINISTER TO GAIN A STRATEGIC EFFECT. If Goering isnt a minister the 4 year plan will cease to trigger and the beneftis won't occur !!!  \n
The Four Year Plan continues apace.  \n IMPORTANT !!! Keep Goering as armaments minister to retain the 5% IC effiency strategic effect and trigger the next stage of the plan. !!! \n

The scheme was not always built upon economic sense and also did not always meet with success. Production in Salzgitter fell below target levels while in Franconia steel and iron works were not completed before the war started. Completing them during war was not of immediate concern. Additionally, Hitler's foreign policy (1936-38/9) brought Germany territories that were richer in raw materials and minerals. Even so, by the mid-1930s Germany was second only to the USA in iron and steel production.

The Milice française (French Militia), generally called the Milice, was a paramilitary force created by the Vichy regime (with German aid) to help fight against the French Resistance during World War II. The Milice's formal head was Prime Minister Pierre Laval, although its Chief of operations and de facto leader was Secretary General Joseph Darnand

The strategic emergency and concomitant manpower shortage resulting from the losses required the creation of infantry divisions that economized on personnel and emphasized defensive strength over offensive strength. The name itself was intended to build morale, appealing at once to nationalism (Volk) and Germany's older military traditions (Grenadier). They were organized around small cadres of hardened veteran soldiers, NCOs and officers," and then bulked out with anything the Replacement Army could supply: "jobless" personnel of the shrinking Kriegsmarine and Luftwaffe", wounded soldiers from broken formations returning to duty from hospitals, older men who would have been considered too old or too unfit for the peacetime army and teenagers were recruited into the ranks.

At three forty-two p.m., twelve minutes after the French arrive, we see Hitler stand up, salute stiffly, and then stride out of the drawing-room, followed by Goring, Brauchitsch, Raeder, Hess, and Ribbentrop. The French, like figures of stone, remain at the green-topped table. General Keitel remains with them. He starts to read them the detailed conditions of the armistice.Hitler and his aides stride down the avenue towards the Alsace-Lorraine monument, where their cars are waiting. As they pass the guard of honour, the German band strikes up the two national anthems, Deutschland," Deutschland uber Alles and the Horst Wessel song. The whole ceremony in which Hitler has reached a new pinnacle in his meteoric career and Germany avenged the 1918 defeat is over in a quarter of an hour."

The 308th Rifle Division, formed on 21 March 1942, as part of the 1st Guards Army of the Soviet Red Army," started using a Bactrian camel brought over from Kazakhstan which the soldiers called kuznechik (Russian for "grasshopper")"," for transport of food and cookery material. It is said that the camel also made it easier for soldiers returning to the camp to locate their unit from the "tall and imposing animal"," visible at a great distance".Kuznechik the camel", carrying out its logistics duties in the rear, was to follow this mostly Siberian military formation all the way to Berlin, where its driver is said to have led the animal to the Reichstag to spit on the ruined building.

The 120th Guards Rifle Division was formed by redesignation of the Red Army's 308th Rifle Division. Part of the 3rd Army of Rokossovskys Front, took active part in the Battle of Stalingrad under Colonel Leontii Gurtev (where it defended the Barrikady factory), the liberation of Orel, Operation Bagration, the campaign for the recapture of Belarus, the East Prussian Offensive and finally the Battle of Berlin.

The Military Administration in France (Militärverwaltung in Frankreich) was an interim occupation authority established by Nazi Germany during World War II to administer the occupied zone in areas of northern and western France. This so-called zone occupée consisted of northern and western France. The departments of Nord and Pas-de-Calais were attached to the military administration in Belgium and Northern France," which was also responsible for civilian affairs in the 20 kilometres wide zone interdite along the Atlantic coast. Another "forbidden zone" were areas in north-eastern France", corresponding to Lorraine and roughly about half each of Franche-Comté, Champagne and Picardie. War refugees were prohibited from returning to their homes, and it was intended for German settlers and annexation in the coming Nazi New Order (Neue Ordnung).
We are the Dead

Only now are the terrible repercussions of Stalin's Purges starting to be felt. The loss of so many trained offiers and the fear based complicance of the survivors is a potential disaster for our command structure. This horror is destined to play itself out many times over during the next 5 years...

German Economy

You are in your office perusing a giant map of Europe when your secretary knocks. 'Reichsmarshall Goering is here to see you, sir,' she says, and before you can even stand straight the portly Luftwaffe chief enters, wringing his hands. 'I know he is very pleased with the rate of growth of the economy,' he says, 'but it has to be reigned in soon. Bubbles will burst.' He is covered in a thin sheen of sweat. You reassure him that everything is going according to plan," and he sees himself out.
German Economy 2

You're settling down to enjoy the congratulatory tea and biscuits Hitler sent you recently when the phone rings. From the heavy breathing alone you know it's Reichsmarshall Goering. 'You must stop this!' he begs. 'You're not the one responsible for the economy, I am! It's all bouquets and chocolates now,"," sure,", but what will happen when the masses are out of work once more? They got us into power - they can take us out of it!' From the other room, Reichsminister Goebbels pops the cork on some champagne," and you decide to hang up on Goering to join the party.
German Economy 3

You sit at your desk with your head in your hands. National stockpiles are depleting fast, unemployment is soaring, the Reichsmark plumetting in value. You have seven missed calls from the Reichschancellery. Your secretary, having just been sacked," hands you a final telegram from the Reichsmarshall. 'I warned you!' it declares. 'It's on your head now.'
German Economy Recovers

The campaign was fought nobly by the troops, unaware of the tension in the government. The vital seizure of resources from the capitals of Europe might just be enough to keep the economy afloat. You attend the meeting of Hitler's inner circle and are treated with stone-cold silence. Hitler and Goebbels won't look at you, but Goering gives you a long stare from across the table," his lips pursed in a grimace. You have kept your head - for now - but it is clear you are no longer trusted the same way.
